bullets.text: Prolonged shutdown is curbing spending, straining food banks and delaying data, as Senate stalemate persists and November jobs report is missed.
Fed’s Miran says surging stablecoin use could lower interest rates by easing money-market frictions and boosting demand for safe assets.
Tech-led selloff delivered worst week since April tariff shock, but S&P 500 held key support; Bitcoin rebounded from bear-market dip.
Deals with Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk could expand obesity-drug access to millions, reshaping payer budgets and bolstering GLP-1 revenues.
Trump’s tariffs are squeezing small businesses while big retailers absorb costs; a Supreme Court brief misstep may undermine the policy’s legal defense.
Trump signaled openness to exempting Hungary from Russian oil sanctions, potentially loosening EU energy unity and advantaging Budapest’s supply options.
Central Asian leaders are engaging Trump to hedge dependence on Moscow and Beijing, seeking investment and security diversification.
U.S. pushes U.N. Security Council to adopt Trump Gaza plan, aiming to shape cease-fire, hostage releases and reconstruction financing.
Hegseth’s abrupt removals of senior military leaders create uncertainty over U.S. force readiness and civil-military stability.
Shutdown-driven FAA restrictions halt many commercial rocket launches, delaying missions and pressuring launch providers’ cash flow.
Budget cuts and agency hacks underscore U.S. cyber exposure; CBO and Washington Post breached amid broader Oracle-linked compromises.
Common pesticide exposure found to cause hidden brain damage, raising regulatory and public-health concerns.
CERN created tiny quark–gluon ‘fireballs’ that may reveal primordial magnetic fields, informing early-universe physics.
Llama-derived nanobodies reduced Alzheimer’s hallmarks in models, offering a compact, blood–brain‑penetrant therapeutic avenue.
Kidney disease is rising alongside diabetes, hypertension and obesity, highlighting prevention and cost pressures on health systems.
